title.narrative: SSC Energy Sector, Indonesia - Phase II

description.narrative:
Strategic Sector Cooperation on Energy Between Denmark and Indonesia, Phase II
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Energy is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Energy Agency and the Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources. The main objective of the Strategic Sector Cooperation is to assist Indonesian government agencies and other relevant stakeholders in developing strategies, policies and solutions to support the implementation of Indonesia’s Nationally Determined Contributions and national targets for electrification, renewable energy and energy efficiency. Indonesia has ambitious policy goals on low-carbon development e.g. 23% new and renewable energy in 2025 and 100% electrification rate of the country in 2025. Reaching these goals in a timely, cost efficient and coherent manner will require a series of actions from the Government of Indonesia enhancing the enabling environment for renewable energy and energy efficiency.
Phase I of the sector cooperation has provided support to low carbon planning and modelling, capacity building, technical assistance for integration of renewable energy and energy efficiency among key stakeholders in Indonesia. Phase II will build on that and continue its collaboration with key energy stakeholders in crucial areas for a green transition of the Indonesian energy mix.
